item.text: FormStorm is a hackathon of forms - collective action for small projects and funders to come together, pitch, share, peer review and explore ideas, experience and areas of common interest.

FormStorm is a hackathon of forms - collective action for small projects and funders to come together, pitch, share, peer review and explore ideas, experience and areas of common interest.

• What can be turned into viable projects which create real value?
  • How can small projects collaborate to make each others teams stronger?
  • What if someone has a great project, but not enough operational capcity to pull it off the ground.

• Build partnerships
  • Build stronger teams
  • Merging ideas into projects
  • Find missing links
  • Communicate common questions to funders

Filling application forms is a stressful and boring. Most of us are not professional fund raisers and don't intend to become that. We just want to build stuff valuable for our communities. We can do it with no money and no support to a certain extent. Thats why, last winter we have started developing an idea of FormStorm.
It is about forking and merging ideas and projects and ideas to create better value and stronger teams.

Filling application forms is a stressful and boring. Most of us are not professional fund raisers and don't intend to become that. We just want to build stuff valuable for our communities. We can do it with no money and no support to a certain extent. Thats why, last winter we have started developing an idea of FormStorm.
FormStorm has three main elements
We have started developing a methodology to run online and offline events aiming at:

• Building partnerships
  • Building stronger teams
  • Merging ideas into projects
  • Forking projects
  • Merging small projects into stronger ones
  • Finding missing links
  • Communicate common questions to funders
  • Learning from mistakes and failures

What is FormStorm for?
To get our heads arounf appication processes such as [[Horizon 2020]].
[[Pages about FormStorm]]
Who is FormStorm for?

• Projects looking for partners
  • People with ideas looking for teams
  • Communities and teams looking for funding
  • Funders looking for good projects
  • Projects and ideas needing feedback
  • Anyone who cold benefit from collective intelligence and collaboration
Main elements of the FormStorm:
To get our heads around appication processes such as [[Horizon 2020]].

story.text:
• Currently working on: [[Horizon 2020]]
  • Applying for: [[CAPS]]
  • How to [[Get Involved in a FormStorm]]
  • Next:[[ICT-enabled Open Government]]

• Projects looking for partners
  • People with ideas looking for teams
  • Communities and teams looking for funding
  • Funders looking for good projects
  • Projects and ideas needing feedback
  • Anyone who cold benefit from collective intelligence and collaboration

Filling application forms is a stressful and boring. Most of us are not professional fund raisers and don't intend to become that. We just want to build stuff valuable for our communities. We can do it with no money and no support only to a certain extent. Thats why, last winter we have started developing an idea of FormStorm.
FormStorm is a hackathon of forms - collective action for small projects and funders to come together, pitch, share, peer review and explore ideas, experience and areas of common interest.
We have started developing a methodology to run online and offline events aiming at:

• Building partnerships
  • Building stronger teams
  • Merging ideas into projects
  • Forking projects
  • Merging small projects into stronger ones
  • Finding missing links
  • Communicate common questions to funders
  • Learning from mistakes and failures

• What can be turned into viable projects which create real value?
  • How can small projects collaborate to make each others teams stronger?
  • What if someone has a great project, but not enough operational capcity to pull it off the ground.
It is about forking and merging ideas and projects and ideas to create better value and stronger teams.
To get our heads around appication processes such as [[Horizon 2020]].
